briefTitle: Algeron (Cepeginterferon Alfa-2b) Compared With PegIntron (Peginterferon Alfa-2b) for Treatment of Chronic Hepatitis C
officialTitle: Multicenter Open-label Randomized Prospective Clinical Study of Efficacy and Safety of Algeron (Cepeginterferon Alfa-2b) in Comparison With PegIntron (Peginterferon Alfa-2b) in the Combined Treatment of Chronic Hepatitis C
summary: The purpose of the study is to demonstrate the noninferiority of Algeron 1.5 and 2.0 μg/kg/week in combination with ribavirin compared to PegIntron in combination with ribavirin in the treatment of chronic hepatitis C, and to determine therapeutic dose of Algeron.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Randomized Patients Achieving Early Virologic Response (EVR) - Negative PCR Result for HCV RNA (< 15 IU/ml) or ≥ 2log10 Decrease of Viral Load After 12 Weeks of Study Treatment.
